page.title: 08ALSTON MOOR'S RAILWAY
page.content: An important attraction for tourists is the {South Tynedale Railway,}the highest{narrow gauge}railway in England. Trains run between Alston station and Gilderdale halt, following part of the route of the old Alston to Haltwhistle branch line. At one point this line crossed the river on a three-arch stone viaduct. Alston station has a pleasant river- side setting, with a picnic area. Part of the restored station building is now a book and souvenir shop together with the local Tourist Information Centre. Alston-Gilderdale halt return=70p;children 5 to 15 years old return=35p.The train runs regularly between April and September,and it travels for a mile and a half along the route; it takes half an hour for the return journey.
